title: US says Trump prefers diplomacy with Iran but warns he has military options
byline: The White House said on Thursday that diplomacy is President Donald Trump’s first choice for dealing with Iran and he will wait to see whether a deal can be struck at high-stakes talks, but also warned that he has military options at his disposal.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Eastern, Uva and Central provinces and in Polonnaruwa and Hambantota districts, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: SC rules Parliamentary Pensions Repeal Bill can be passed with simple majority
byline: The Supreme Court has determined that no provision in the Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill is inconsistent with the Constitution, and that it can be enacted by Parliament with a simple majority, Speaker of the House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne stated.

title: Police enhance security measures for 2026 ICC T20 World Cup matches
byline: Sri Lanka Police has announced that a total of 1,500 police officers and 600 traffic police officers will be deployed to ensure the safety and security of both local and foreign spectators attending the 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Cricket Tournament.

title: Special traffic plan in Colombo during 2026 ICC T20 World Cup matches
byline: A special traffic plan will be implemented in Colombo during the 2026 ICC T20 World Cup Cricket Tournament, which will be held from February 07 to March 08, 2026.

title: President to launch compensation, housing projects for Cyclone Ditwah victims in Kandy today
byline: The programme to commence the construction of new houses for individuals whose homes were fully or partially damaged by Cyclone Ditwah in the Kandy District, along with the awarding of compensation and the launch of several development projects, is scheduled to take place in Kandy today (06)...

title: Gen Z became first generation to be less intelligent than millennials as IQ dropped, expert
byline: Recent studies suggest that Gen Z is the first and only generation to be less intelligent than the one before it, making millennials the only generation to outperform the younger generation that followed.

title: Three suspects arrested with ‘Kush’ worth over Rs. 20 mln at BIA
byline: A Sri Lankan passenger who arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) has been arrested for allegedly attempting to smuggle a consignment of ‘Kush’ valued at over Rs. 20 million into the country.

title: Train services on main line delayed
byline: Trains operating along the main railway line are currently experiencing delays, according to Sri Lanka Railways.

title: Anusha Palpita further remanded
byline: Former Secretary to the Ministry of Mass Media and former Chairman of the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL), Anusha Palpita, has been further remanded until February 20 by the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court.

title: Court defers decision on Dayasiri’s petition over SLFP General Secretary post
byline: The Colombo District Court today (06) ordered that the delivery of the verdict on the case filed by Member of Parliament Dayasiri Jayasekara be postponed until February 17.

title: Decisions and judgments of Supreme Court reflect justice in country – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the decisions and judgments delivered within the Supreme Court complex serve as a mirror that clearly reflects the justice, democracy, and the rule of law in Sri Lanka.

title: Norway investigates former PM Jagland over alleged Epstein links
byline: Police in Norway have opened a corruption investigation into the country’s former Prime Minister Thorbjørn Jagland over his alleged links to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Woman arrested with ‘Hashish’ and ‘Kush’ worth over Rs. 15 mln
byline: A woman was arrested by the Western Province North Crime Division during an operation carried out in the Nirmala Mawatha area of Boralesgamuwa.

title: Govt ready to commence paddy purchases in upcoming season – Dy Minister
byline: The Deputy Minister of Lands and Irrigation, Aravinda Senarath, informed Parliament today (06) that the government has completed all necessary arrangements to commence the purchasing of paddy.

title: President’s Fund allocates over Rs. 1.9 bln for schoolchildren affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: An allocation of Rs. 1,925,010,000.00 has been made from the President’s Fund to provide a Rs. 10,000 allowance for schoolchildren in all districts affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: NASA will finally let astronauts take smartphones to the Moon
byline: NASA is about to make a small but meaningful change that feels very human. For the first time, astronauts heading toward the Moon will be allowed to carry modern smartphones, including iPhones.

title: Seven school students hospitalized following violent clash in Beruwala
byline: Seven students were admitted to Kalutara Teaching Hospital after sustaining injuries in a violent clash between students from two schools in the Beruwala area.
